metadata.title: CVE-2016-10196 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in the evutil_parse_sockaddr_port function inevutil.c in libevent before 2.1.6-beta allows attackers to cause a denialof service (segmentation fault) via vectors involving a long string inbrackets in the ip_as_string argument.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10196` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 53.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 53.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 53.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 53.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

libevent-2.0-5 - 2.0.21-stable-2ubuntu0.16.04.1
libevent-core-2.0-5 - 2.0.21-stable-2ubuntu0.16.04.1
libevent-extra-2.0-5 - 2.0.21-stable-2ubuntu0.16.04.1
libevent-openssl-2.0-5 - 2.0.21-stable-2ubuntu0.16.04.1
libevent-pthreads-2.0-5 - 2.0.21-stable-2ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '53.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:52.1.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
libevent package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.21-stable-2ubuntu0.16.04.1').
